scenarios.name: E2E - Create Formula-Based Metric with Weekly Cadence and Custom Target
scenarios.description: This scenario verifies the complete end-to-end happy path for a user creating a new metric using the Formula Builder, setting a Weekly cadence, adding it to their dashboard, and configuring a 4-level Custom Target.
user_journey: Step 1: Navigate to the Application and verify the login page is displayed.
Step 2: Enter the user's email address and click the 'Continue' button.
Step 3: Enter the user's password and click the 'Login' button.
Step 4: Select the specified company from the list.
Step 5: Verify that the dashboard page is displayed after successful login.
Step 6: Navigate to the Metrics page by clicking 'Metrics' in the navigation menu.
Step 7: Initiate metric creation by clicking the 'Add Metric' button.
Step 8: Enter the metric name in the 'Name' input field.
Step 9: Select 'Formula' from the 'Value Source' dropdown.
Step 10: Verify the 'Formula Builder' interface is visible.
Step 11: Search for and select the first metric for the formula.
Step 12: Click on the desired operator button.
Step 13: Search for and select the second metric for the formula.
Step 14: Verify the complete formula is displayed correctly.
Step 14A: Select 'Weekly' from the 'Cadence' dropdown.
Step 14B: Verify the 'Resets On' dropdown appears and select a day of the week.
Step 15: Click the green checkmark button to confirm the formula.
Step 17: Click the 'Save' button to create the metric.
Step 18: Navigate to 'My Dashboard' from the 'Dashboards' menu.
Step 19: Open the 'Edit KPI' modal.
Step 21: Locate the newly created metric in the left panel of available metrics.
Step 22: Click the metric in the left panel to add it to the right panel.
Step 23: Click the 'Save' button in the modal to save the KPI configuration.
Step 24: Wait for the dashboard to render the new KPI card.
Step 25: Locate the correct metric card on the dashboard.
Step 26: Hover over the metric card to reveal the three-dot menu button.
Step 27: Click the three-dot menu button to open the dropdown menu.
Step 28: Identify the active dropdown menu.
Step 29: Click the 'Edit' option in the dropdown menu.
Step 30: Wait for the Edit page to load completely.
Step 31: Select the 'Target' tab if it is not already active.
Step 32A.1: Select the 'Custom' radio button.
Step 32A.2: Verify that 4 target input fields appear.
Step 32A.3: Enter the Level 1 target value.
Step 32A.4: Enter the Level 2 target value.
Step 32A.5: Enter the Level 3 target value.
Step 32A.6: Enter the Level 4 target value.
Step 33: Click the 'Save' button to save the target configuration.
Step 34: Wait for the page to navigate back to the dashboard.
Step 35: Verify the target is visible on the metric card with performance level indicators.
Step 36: Perform a final verification of the metric card's name, value, and target visualization.
acceptance_criteria: User successfully logs in and selects the correct company.
A new metric is successfully created using a formula with two existing metrics and a Weekly cadence.
The newly created metric is successfully added to 'My Dashboard KPIs'.
The user can successfully navigate to the metric's edit page from the dashboard.
A 4-level Custom Target is successfully configured and saved.
The metric card on the dashboard correctly displays the visual indicators for the saved Custom Target.
test_data_requirements: First_Metric: Name of a valid, existing metric
Second_Metric: Name of a second valid, existing metric

scenarios.name: Functional - Create Formula-Based Metric with Quarterly Cadence and Add to Dashboard
scenarios.description: This scenario verifies the core functionality of creating a formula-based metric with a Quarterly cadence and successfully adding it to the 'My Dashboard KPIs' without configuring a target.
user_journey: Step 1: Navigate to the Application and verify the login page is displayed.
Step 2: Enter the user's email address and click the 'Continue' button.
Step 3: Enter the user's password and click the 'Login' button.
Step 4: Select the specified company from the list.
Step 5: Verify that the dashboard page is displayed after successful login.
Step 6: Navigate to the Metrics page by clicking 'Metrics' in the navigation menu.
Step 7: Initiate metric creation by clicking the 'Add Metric' button.
Step 8: Enter the metric name in the 'Name' input field.
Step 9: Select 'Formula' from the 'Value Source' dropdown.
Step 10: Verify the 'Formula Builder' interface is visible.
Step 11: Search for and select the first metric for the formula.
Step 12: Click on the desired operator button.
Step 13: Search for and select the second metric for the formula.
Step 14: Verify the complete formula is displayed correctly.
Step 14A: Select 'Quarterly' from the 'Cadence' dropdown.
Step 15: Click the green checkmark button to confirm the formula.
Step 17: Click the 'Save' button to create the metric.
Step 18: Navigate to 'My Dashboard' from the 'Dashboards' menu.
Step 19: Open the 'Edit KPI' modal.
Step 21: Locate the newly created metric in the left panel of available metrics.
Step 22: Click the metric in the left panel to add it to the right panel.
Step 23: Click the 'Save' button in the modal and wait for the dashboard to refresh.
acceptance_criteria: User successfully logs in and navigates to the Metrics page.
A new metric using the Formula Builder and a Quarterly cadence is created and saved successfully.
The user can successfully find and add the new metric to 'My Dashboard KPIs'.
The new metric card appears correctly in the 'My KPIs' section on the dashboard.
The metric card on the dashboard does not display any target configuration visuals.
test_data_requirements: First_Metric: Name of a valid, existing metric
Second_Metric: Name of a second valid, existing metric

dependencies: A valid test user account with the specified credentials must exist and be active.
The specified company must exist and be accessible to the test user.
For scenarios involving formula or existing metric creation, the prerequisite metrics ('First Metric', 'Second Metric', 'Metric to Select') must exist in the system before the test starts.
The application's authentication, metrics, and dashboard modules must be deployed and functional.
The test environment must be stable, with no ongoing deployments or critical outages.

test_data.metric_name: [Name of the metric to be created]
test_data.resets_on: [Day of week - only if Cadence = Weekly]
test_data.first_metric: [Name of first metric to use in formula]
test_data.second_metric: [Name of second metric to use in formula]
test_data.custom_target_values: [4 values from highest to lowest - Level 1, Level 2, Level 3, Level 4]
